intro: Plumbagella, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plumbaginaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-blue foliage, which are often used in ornamental gardening. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Plumbagella species are generally low-growing shrubs or herbs, with some varieties reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. They are known for their ability to tolerate salt spray and are often used in coastal landscaping.
